header.title: The best fence installation company in Woodland
bullets: Create, review and edit your FREE quote online using our custom tool.
Ask questions to our friendly, responsive team.
Understand what’s included with your project with our transparent quotes and pricing.
Enjoy your new fence built by our team of skilled local craftsmen.

Yelp.description: Working with Ergeon was great, from them responding quickly to my quote request to completing my fence in less than two weeks from when I contacted them. The process was easy, the contract was thorough, every person I interacted with was polite and friendly. And my fence looks awesome!
Yelp.name: Mary H.
Yelp.title: The process was easy, the contract was thorough, and every person I interacted with was polite and friendly.

Google.description: Lhacya was extremely helpful in getting us set up with a quote when the wind knocked down our fence. She walked us through the whole process even as we changed our mind more than once. We're very grateful for all her knowledge and quick turnaround! We had a great experience with Ergeon, throughout the whole installation. We love our new fence, and the whole process was great.
Google.name: Cameron S.
Google.title: We had a great experience with Ergeon, throughout the whole installation.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.setback: 5 foot (5’) from the street side property line for fences greater than 3’-6” in height. Fences 3’-6” in height or less may be located within the 5 foot (5’) setback. Side yard fences over 3’-6” in height require 10 foot setback from driveways; even on adjacent properties
faq.corner-lot-rules: Fences greater than 3'-6” in height shall have a 5 foot (5’) setback from the street side property line. Fences 3’-6” in height or less may be located within the 5 foot (5’) setback. Side yard fences over 3’-6” in height require 10 foot setback from driveways; even on adjacent properties.

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
